intro: Endocellion boreale, commonly known as the northern endocellion, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in nutrient-poor, acidic soils and thrives in cold, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, adapted to withstand harsh winter conditions. Endocellion boreale plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for specialized insect species.
